text: Morning <@U010GM77S4W> - this is a possible future betting enhancement.  The existing functionality is only available to UK based customers due to a specific requirement from the Gambling Commission.

elements.text: Morning
- this is a possible future betting enhancement.  The existing functionality is only available to UK based customers due to a specific requirement from the Gambling Commission.

text: However, the way the underlying tech was built will allow us to offer the functionality in a more sophisticated way than a toggle at bet/account level.  It allows the bet matcher to lapse a bet if best execution would give more than a X% increase in price.  The thinking being, if you back a horse at 10.0 in-running and get 10.5, you’re happy, whereas if you get 1000, you know your horse has fallen and you’re not.

elements.text: However, the way the underlying tech was built will allow us to offer the functionality in a more sophisticated way than a toggle at bet/account level.  It allows the bet matcher to lapse a bet if best execution would give more than a X% increase in price.  The thinking being, if you back a horse at 10.0 in-running and get 10.5, you’re happy, whereas if you get 1000, you know your horse has fallen and you’re not.

text: Morning <@UUCD6P13J> - the effect has been very positive driving increased customer engagement.   We initially carried out a trial reducing the Euro min bet size to €1.  Due to the results of this trial we've since reduced the min stake to £1 and have made further changes across multiple currencies since Monday 28th March.

elements.text: Morning

- the effect has been very positive driving increased customer engagement.   We initially carried out a trial reducing the Euro min bet size to €1.  Due to the results of this trial we've since reduced the min stake to £1 and have made further changes across multiple currencies since Monday 28th March.

text: Hi <@UBS7QANF3> - this was just a thought experiment and interesting to hear differing views on this. We have no plans to publish this.

elements.text: Hi
- this was just a thought experiment and interesting to hear differing views on this. We have no plans to publish this.

text:
Morning <@U018YDJUKPZ> - The rational for the change was to optimise the time customer have to wait for a bet to be matched without causing an unfair advantage for faster feeds/courtsiders.
 When we trialed this we didn’t see major impact on sweeping or fasting losing rates to suggest that moving high profile tennis to a 3 second delay would have a negative affect on the market. However we did see wait time for bet drop and therefore matching rates increase.

elements.text: Morning

- The rational for the change was to optimise the time customer have to wait for a bet to be matched without causing an unfair advantage for faster feeds/courtsiders.
 When we trialed this we didn’t see major impact on sweeping or fasting losing rates to suggest that moving high profile tennis to a 3 second delay would have a negative affect on the market. However we did see wait time for bet drop and therefore matching rates increase.

text: Hi <@U01MPC0GUK1> - This was a commercial decision.  The target audience for the feed is customers who are looking to trade significant volumes on cricket and this group fits this criteria.  We'll also review any requests from customers who are interested in trading on cricket as the result of us introducing this feed.

elements.text: Hi

- This was a commercial decision.  The target audience for the feed is customers who are looking to trade significant volumes on cricket and this group fits this criteria.  We'll also review any requests from customers who are interested in trading on cricket as the result of us introducing this feed.

text: Hi <@U01A3B4SBDZ> - we have explored this a number of times in the past.  However, we haven't been able to agree commercial terms to provide this information via the API.  We are always revisiting this, so I'd never say never!

text:
<@UNW8Q88EL>
Unfortunately an unfair advantage has been created and this is not just my opinion but the opinion of many traders I know who trade manually.
Very often there is not enough 1 second to cancel in spite of the fact that I use the fastest sources available to ordinary users.
Thanks for the answer and for the opportunity to ask Betfair representatives directly.:+1:

elements.text:

text: As a thought experiment: there's been discussion about removing the in play delay depending whether you're making or taking, but what about providing visibility of volume that is in the queue but delayed and not available to be matched yet? If I can see that in 5 seconds that the price is about to move strongly, I can decide to cancel bets and join the queue, etc. - it might force changes in behaviour that may or may not be desirable. Ever thought about this?

elements.text: As a thought experiment: there's been discussion about removing the in play delay depending whether you're making or taking, but what about providing visibility of volume that is in the queue but delayed and not available to be matched yet? If I can see that in 5 seconds that the price is about to move strongly, I can decide to cancel bets and join the queue, etc. - it might force changes in behaviour that may or may not be desirable. Ever thought about this?

text: I don't think position in queue is the same. I'm saying that by making delayed queue visible, you're effectively making courtsider/drone orders visible even if I'm not in the queue or I am and want out because their money is moving in quick. Was just a thought anyway.
